p: Song and colleagues, 2016, also confirmed the effect of rosemary extract containing 20% carnosic acid on the improvement of cognitive deficits in rats and it might be mediated by anti-oxidative (decreased ROS and increased superoxide dismutase (SOD)) and anti-inflammatory (reduced protein level of TNF-α, IL-6, and IL-1β in hippocampus) properties of rosemary ( 42). However, the pharmacological mechanisms behind the improvement in cognitive deficits are not clear enough and further examinations are needed to find the exact relationship between different doses of rosemary extract and improvement in cognitive deficits.
